properties.name: Big Ben
properties.description: Posted by Chef27 Big Ben is a clock tower. It has 4 dials that are 23 square feet, and a minute hand that is 14 feet long. The digits are 2 feet high. Big Ben is actually not the clock tower, but the 13 ton bell hung within. The name comes from Sir Benjamin Hall who did the first constructing. The bell came from an old palace in west minister. People always know that parliment is in session, because a light shines above the clock face.

properties.name: Biltmore House
properties.description: Posted by Chef27Ashville, North Carolina The Biltmore House was built by George Washington Vanderbilt II in 1888 to 1895. It is still owned by their desendents. It was open to the public in 1930 due to the depression. The house is 175,000 square feet. It has an 17,000 gallon indoor swimming pool and a bowling alley. It even had intercom and elevators. The grounds also have gardens and a winery.

properties.name: Eiffel Tower
properties.description: Posted by Chef27Paris, France The Eiffel Tower is an immense structure of exposed latticework supports made of iron. It took 300 steel workers and 2 years to construct it. There are 15,000 iron pieces and 2.5 million rivots. It is 986 feet tall without the antenna. It weighs 8.56 million kg. There are 1671 steps to the top of the tower.

properties.name: Great Wall of China
properties.description: Posted by Chef27Beijing,China The Great Wall exends from the North China coast to the deserts of Central Asia. It is teh largest wall in teh world. The wall is 4,700 miles long. The original wall 20 feet tall, but now it is eight feet tall. When stone was not available they used 4inch layers of tamped earth. The mortar had a secret ingrediant, rice flower.

properties.name: Leaning Tower of pisa
properties.description: Posted by Chef27 The official name of the tower is Torre Pendente Di Pisa. The tilt of the tower was first noticed in 1173. 1173 to 1250 the tower leaned north, then from 1272 to 1997 it leaned to the south. The tower is 185 feet tall and has 8 stories. It weighs about 14,700 metric tons. The walls are 8 feet thick.

properties.name: MT Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by Chef27Black Hills, South Dakota Mt. Rushmore is a 60 foot sculpture of George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt, and Abraham Lincoln. The mountain is 5,725 feet tall. The carving is 61 years old. It took 14 years to carve the faces. It cost million. It was carved by Gutzon Borglum, and is son Lincoln after is death.

properties.name: Ruby Falls
properties.description: Posted by Chef271720 Scenic highway Chattonooga, tenn. Ruby Falls is an underground water fall, under Lookout mountain. It is 837 feet above sea level, 1120 feet beneath the mountains surface. The falls is 145 feet, and it is in a limestone cave. This is one of the largest waterfalls open to the public. During the Cuban Missile Crisis Ruby falls was a fallout shelter. Fish can not live in the falls because of the high mineral content.

properties.name: Statue of Liberty
properties.description: Posted by Chef27Liberty Island New York, NY The Statue of Liberty was given to the United States in 1886 as a recognition of friendship. It was built by Auguste Bartholdi. It took nine years and tons of workers to finish. The Statue has 354 stairs and 35 windows in her crown. She has seven spikes in her crown. She is made of copper and weighs 450,000 pounds.

properties.name: Stonehenge
properties.description: Posted by Chef27 Stonehenge is an ancient place in England where there has thought to have been tribal gatherings and a religious center. The large stones are in circles. It was built from 2800 to 1500 b.c. Some of the stones are missing because people have taken them to be used on briges. It is said that there were 60 stones there at one time. It really is a mystery why they were there and how they were built.

properties.name: Sydney Opera House
properties.description: Posted by Chef27Sydney Harbor, Austalia The Opera house was designed by a danish architect Jorn Utzon. The roof was designed to look like a ship at full sail. The building was 185 metres long and 120 metres wide. The total cost to build was 102,000,000. It was opened by Queen Elizabeth II on October 20,1973. It\'s first performance was "War and Peace" by Prokofiev.
